scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
phas, rus, phos, serum, hb, costs, pho, pies, trigue, cu, lu, dal, men, oc, en, feu, maid, in

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — SYN: first
B. (2 syllables) — SYN: connive
C. (2 syllables) — SYN: lm
D. (3 syllables) — SYN: Lucifer
E. (1 syllables) — The watery portion of certain other animal fluids, such as milk; whey.
F. (3 syllables) — SYN: absorb
G. (2 syllables) — of or relating to or characteristic of feudalism
H. (1 syllables) — SYN: be

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
hea, char, dossier, tic, tan, ic, lif, ter, vestor, tors, u, change, in, quad, ac, pro, reg, ing, painter, is, ter, lat, sec, then

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — not acknowledging the God of Christianity and Judaism and Islam
B. (4 syllables) — fix or adjust the time, amount, degree, or rate of
C. (2 syllables) — a plane figure bounded by two radii and the included arc of a circle
D. (1 syllables) — A collection of papers and/or other sources, containing detailed information about a particular person or subject, together with a synopsis of their content.
E. (3 syllables) — bearing in abundance especially offspring
F. (5 syllables) — a prominent attribute or aspect of something
G. (3 syllables) — to switch (each of two things)
H. (1 syllables) — (printing) a block of type without a raised letter; used for spacing between words or sentences
I. (1 syllables) — a worker who is employed to cover objects with paint

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
will, de, dral, col, graph, un, tive, tem, ic, pho, cep, a, ing, vre, rut, noeu, tures, ing, lege, ma, free, cathe, to, per, dius

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ing) — make (information) available for publication
B. (4 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ic) — Pertaining to photographs or photography.
C. (4 syllables) — the degree of hotness or coldness of a body or environment (corresponding to its molecular activity)
D. (3 syllables) — direct the course; determine the direction of travelling
E. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -al) — relating to or containing or issuing from a bishop's office or throne
F. (1 syllables) — hollow out in the form of a furrow or groove
G. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: de-, suffix: -ive) — causing one to believe what is not true or fail to believe what is true
H. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: un-, suffix: -ing) — not disposed or inclined toward
I. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: co-) — An academic institution.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
tened, vices, o, di, tive, flec, re, main, tos, dus, grass, ied, plined, bod, mond, blue, re, shawl, zenith, hin, ol, chae, a, san, gist, snapped, maori, ar

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — an area in central Kentucky noted for it [masked] and thoroughbred horses
B. (5 syllables) — Someone who studies or practises archaeology.
C. (1 syllables) — Of, from, or pertaining to the [masked].
D. (1 syllables) — cloak consisting of an oblong piece of cloth used to cover the head and shoulders
E. (3 syllables) — Reciprocal.
F. (3 syllables) — Made of, or containing diamond, a diamond or diamonds.
G. (2 syllables) — a person who adheres to Hinduism
H. (2 syllables) — a port city in southwestern Brazil on an offshore island near Sao Paulo
I. (2 syllables) — having a body or a body of a specified kind; often used in combination
J. (2 syllables) — be left; of persons, questions, problems, results, evidence, etc.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
